alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Garvin; McClain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 12:47AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Garvin, southeastern Grady, southeastern Cleveland and McClain Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1247 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Middleberg to near Bradley to 7 miles northeast of Bray. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Norman, Blanchard, Pauls Valley, Purcell, Noble, Slaughterville, Lindsay, Lexington, Goldsby, Maysville, Dibble, Wayne, Washington, Paoli, Cole, Alex, Bradley, Rosedale, Tabler, and Antioch. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 69 and 104. Interstate 44 between mile markers 86 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
